You can use this API to modify and rearrange tab groups in the browser
interact with the browser's tab system. You can use this API to create, modify, and rearrange tabs in the browser

Various get functions. Gets the HTML document set as the browser action's popup.

Enables an extension to modify certain global browser settings.
Enables extensions to clear the data that is accumulated while the user is browsing.

Determine the captive portal state of the user's connection. A captive portal is a web page displayed when a user first connects to a Wi-Fi network. The user provides information or acts on the captive portal web page to gain broader access to network resources, such as accepting terms and conditions or making a payment.
Fired when a command is executed using its associated keyboard shortcut.
retrieves information about a single cookie, given its name and URL.

Get the Window object for your extension's pages. Get the values for various settings.
